perturbation.original_text: 7.2 Governing Law. This Agreement and any claim, controversy or dispute arising out of or related to this Agreement, any of the transactions contemplated hereby and/or the interpretation and enforcement of the rights and duties of the Parties, whether arising in contract, tort, equity or otherwise, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the domestic laws of the State of Israel (including in respect of the statute of limitations or other limitations period applicable to any such claim, controversy or dispute), without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule (whether of the State of Israel or any other jurisdiction) that would cause the application of the laws of any jurisdiction other than the State of Israel.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.2 Governing Law. This Agreement and any claim, controversy or dispute arising out of or related to this Agreement, any of the transactions contemplated hereby and/or the interpretation and enforcement of the rights and duties of the Parties, whether arising in contract, tort, equity or otherwise, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the domestic laws of the State of Israel unless otherwise agreed to in writing by both parties at the time of a dispute.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies that Israeli law governs the agreement. The modification introduces an exception allowing for an alternative agreement at the time of a dispute. This contradicts the initial provision, creating uncertainty about which jurisdiction's laws ultimately apply. This affects the enforceability of the clause because it is unclear whether the reference to the Israeli laws is actually binding or subject to change.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles regarding certainty and definiteness of terms.

perturbation.original_text: 7.3 Consent to Jurisdiction. The Parties hereby irrevocably submit any disputes under this Agreement to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located in Tel-Aviv, Israel, provided however, that Recipient shall be entitled to seek an injunction or other appropriate remedy against Provider in the country in which Provider has acted in breach of the terms hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.3 Consent to Jurisdiction. The Parties hereby submit any disputes under this Agreement to the jurisdiction of the courts located in Tel-Aviv, Israel, provided however, that either party shall be entitled to seek an injunction or other appropriate remedy against the other in a mutually agreed upon country.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies the exclusive jurisdiction of the Tel-Aviv courts but allows Recipient to seek injunctions elsewhere. The modified text removes the 'irrevocably' aspect, making jurisdiction discretionary and opens it to mutually agreed upon country, which introduces an element of uncertainty and potential conflict regarding where disputes should be resolved. By adding 'mutually agreed upon country' for both parties, it introduces contradiction and ambiguity.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles regarding certainty and definiteness of terms.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1 Indemnification. Provider shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Recipient and its officers, directors, employees, agents, affiliates, successors, and permitted assigns (collectively, "Indemnified Party") against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, claims, actions, judgments, settlements, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind, including attorneys' fees, fees and the costs of enforcing any right to indemnification under this Agreement, and the cost of pursuing any insurance providers, incurred by Indemnified Party or awarded against Indemnified Party (collectively, "Losses"), relating to/arising out of or resulting from any claim of a third party or Recipient arising out of or occurring in connection with Provider's negligence, willful misconduct, or breach of this Agreement. Provider shall not enter into any settlement without Recipient's or Indemnified Party's prior written consent.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1 Indemnification. Provider shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Recipient and its officers, directors, employees, agents, affiliates, successors, and permitted assigns (collectively, "Indemnified Party") against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, claims, actions, judgments, settlements, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind, including attorneys' fees, fees and the costs of enforcing any right to indemnification under this Agreement, and the cost of pursuing any insurance providers, incurred by Indemnified Party or awarded against Indemnified Party (collectively, "Losses"), relating to/arising out of or resulting from any claim of a third party or Recipient arising out of or occurring in connection with Provider's negligence, willful misconduct, or breach of this Agreement. Provider shall not enter into any settlement without Recipient's or Indemnified Party's prior written consent. However, if Provider reasonably believes a settlement is in the best interest of both parties, Provider can proceed with the settlement without Recipient's consent.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause says that Provider cannot enter into any settlement without the Recipient's consent. The modified clause allows Provider to proceed without Recipient's consent, creating a direct contradiction and uncertainty regarding the control over settlement decisions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles regarding the binding nature of contractual obligations and the ability of parties to modify them.
